ProgramElementNote.val: Starting in FY21, funds realigned from PE 0204575N.

ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
Navy is developing foundational tools in support of the Cyber Mission Force in accordance with requirements, guidance, and previous work completed. (Additional details held at a higher classification)

Funding provided for the following:
- Cyberspace support facilities, infrastructure lease and fit-up of additional space
- Program office, program management, engineering, administrative, and security support 
- Specialized Cyberspace technical, engineering, and management capabilities
- Expand Cyberspace Activities development network and network support
- Cyberspace hardware and software reverse engineering 
- Research and Development (R&D) activities
- Cyberspace tool development
- Cyberspace activity logistics support costs

SummaryExplanation.val: Project 2958: Increase of $5.967 million between FY20 and FY21 is a phased increase that started in FY19 to advance and improve the Navy's capacity for tool development to meet the demands of the cyber mission forces as US Cyber Command completes transition of all foundational tool development to the Services (Navy, Army, and Air Force). Funds expand and build on establishment of highly skilled and capable subject matter expertise ($ 1.41 million) and development infrastructure and engineering ($0.37 million) needed to meet the challenges of offensive cyber operations to support great power competition. Software testing will be expanded ($.47 million). An operational rehearsal system that incorporates real hardware constructively in a virtual environment will be developed ($3.29 million). Development of a tactical delivery platform for cyber effects will be defined, and a requirements document written ($.43 million).

ProjectNote.val: Starting in FY21, funds realigned from PE 0204575N, project 2958.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
Navy is developing foundational tools in support of the Cyber Mission Force in accordance with requirements, guidance, and previous work completed. (Additional details held at a higher classification)

Funding provided for the following:
- Cyberspace support facilities, infrastructure lease and fit-up of additional space
- Program office, program management, engineering, administrative, and security support
- Specialized Cyberspace technical, engineering, and management capabilities
- Expand Cyberspace Activities development network and network support
- Cyberspace hardware and software reverse engineering
- Research and Development (R&D) activities
- Cyberspace tool development
- Cyberspace activity logistics support costs

Starting in FY21, funds realigned from PE 0204575N, project 2958. Funds provided to advance/improve the capacity for tool development to meet cyber mission forces demands as U.S. Cyber Command completes transition of all foundational tool development to the Services (Navy, Army, and Air Force). Highly skilled and capable Subject Matter Expertise (SME) is required to meet the challenges of offensive cyber operations to support great power competition. An operational rehearsal system that incorporates real hardware constructively in a virtual environment will be developed. Development of a tactical delivery platform for cyber effects will be defined, and a document of requirements will be written.

Text.val:
Identify and document requirements for Navy's tactical delivery platform for delivery of cyber effects from the Joint Cyber Warfare Architecture. 
- Contract to increase software capacity for cyber mission forces
- Test government-developed software capabilities prior to delivery to operational forces.
- Ensure signature diversity.
- Conduct vulnerability analysis.
- Perform configuration management.
- Deliver software documentation.
- Deliver specific, well-defined tools to operational cyber mission forces.
- Sustain previously developed tools to maintain relevancy.

AppChangeSummary.val:
FY21 funds were realigned from PE 0204575N, project 2958. This is not a new start since it is a PE change only.

Funding with PE 0204575N in FY20 was $29 million. The increase of $5.967 million between FY20 and FY21 is a phased increase that started in FY19 to advance and improve the Navy's capacity for tool development to meet the demands of the cyber mission forces as US Cyber Command completes transition of all foundational tool development to the Services (Navy, Army, and Air Force). Funds expand and build on establishment of highly skilled and capable subject matter expertise ($ 1.41 million) and development infrastructure and engineering ($0.37 million) needed to meet the challenges of offensive cyber operations to support great power competition. Software testing will be expanded ($.47 million). An operational rehearsal system that incorporates real hardware constructively in a virtual environment will be developed ($3.29 million). Development of a tactical delivery platform for cyber effects will be defined, and a requirements document written ($.43 million).
